Delete ZeroNet.conf if you ever mess up configuration. The file will be recreated next time you start ZeroNet. Back up users.json as it has your identity and it's unrecoverable if lost or deleted unless it's still in the recycle bin. Back up your Data folder if you don't want to redownload everything in the event that you can't fix a problem and resort to reinstalling ZeroNet.

What @Version: said are the two most important, your ID and list of connected sites. If you only back those up, you can recover, just more slowly. The two files are quite small. The Data folder has everything including all the files you've downloaded, so that video and those pictures you really like remain instead of requiring redownload.

This can work on any platform as long as the message size doesn't exceed a character limit, so Twitter and Mastodon might not be ideal for it, but other social networks with no limit will probably be fine, as long as the encrypted output isn't mistaken for formatting syntax.

@Vaerospace: Why is water second guessed in chemical makeup by the likes of you? Do you know about photosynthesis, electrolysis, respiration and combustion? The explanations come full circle if you simply test them. A closed off terrarium filled with plants and a few insects sitting in sunlight makes a complete oxygen cycle. A byproduct of burning the hydrocarbons produced in photosynthesis or oxygen and hydrogen gas produced in electrolysis is water. How about a video to help you out? And, while you're on YouTube, look up the experiments. Replicate them. Science allows all to participate and discover the workings of nature for themselves. It's not a cult nor alumni club. I'm definitely no bar for measuring intelligence. Many people have their weaknesses. I make a fool of myself.

I honestly believe that Russia was made into quite the scapegoat by the DNC. They've tried convincing people that Bernie is implicated in Russian influence, which is bullshit. In the past, Russia had worked with the US to fight terrorists. Hillary had connections with UraniumOne as well as Trump, but it's ignored by the media and that's not unexpected post Citizens United to have oligarchs and royalty foreign and domestic influence candidates. What Democrats don't want to do is prosecute Trump over general corrupt activities nor acknowledge overlap in Russian oligarch influence they too have accepted, which would also include influence from Saudi Arabian royalty or other oligarchs outside Russia. They could, but the reason they don't is because they too are corrupt, so it's the red scare and ignoring own guilt over stopping all corruption. It would undo Citizens United, the judgment that legalized unlimited donations by oligarchs and royalty domestic and foreign. Guess who's actually defending Syria: Russia. Who framed Assad? The CIA. The Russia collusion scandal is a distraction from the larger problem. Corrupt parties calculate their plans for prosecution so they themselves can still carry on corrupt activities, throwing the other corrupt people and innocents under a bus that they themselves no less deserve to happen to them as well. I'm not against Trump being prosecuted, but as I said, it misses the larger problem. Very few are truly innocent of financial influence by domestic or foreign oligarchs and royalty. We can't be satisfied with only Trump's cabinet being prosecuted. That's a narrow scope. Hillary and the DNC need to be implicated as well, but sadly they might drop charges on Trump if that ever happened, unless they hold all the cards, and the media is in their hands. The complexity of the whole fiasco is greater than the media would lead you to believe. I'm far from feeling satiated. The RNC and DNC are both corrupt. No outsider becomes president. Our government is thoroughly rigged.

@leftside: It's entirely possible that I've fallen for a circulated lie, but no less do the both of us see the bigger problem. I hope as much as you do that more is done so as to stop all corruption. The lesser prosecuted aren't the lesser guilty. Regardless, it feels almost pointless of me to press the issue, because I believe the deception will be pervasive. I can only rely on the independent thinkers like you and I to not fall for the grander hypocrisies. I've not been able to sway those in love with Hillary to see her faults. Her degrees of separation from Trump are few at best and symbolic at worst.

I share in perceptions of what's wrong with the world with most everyone, but without the blanket hatred, and I find myself seeing possible conspiracies a level deeper than most. I refuse to block anything on the grounds of political and other ideas that I disagree with, not even blocking racists. I think it's best to make constructive debates or scroll by what we might not agree with. I only block what is unnecessary and very illegal in most places, which includes camera-recorded porn that contains minors, Jihadists and scammers or enablers of terrorists. The clearnet is actually less clean of those things that I block here. My goal is to make ZeroNet generally safer for people who opt into my blocklists, not create echo chambers nor safe spaces, and it's working well. I believe political isolationism via blocklists would make ZeroNet too comfy for the political extremists who don't like  seeing opposing views and cause and endless demand to make everyone ignorant of the gamut of ideas bad or good and  be happy about it like I'm sedating them. Neither disliking someone nor not seeing eye to eye will ever be a reason for me to put them on a blocklist, save for Jihadists. Nobody in their remotely nor absolutely right mind likes Jihadists.

You probably shouldn't make every file required.
@Bussdee: In content.json:  "optional": "data/.*",
Then place media files there. You can host scripts, stylesheets, images, music and videos via ZeroNet without doing anything special. External resourcing is discouraged.

@Bussdee: on your own site in any folder listed like the data folder is, any structure you want. Just know that base href only goes three directories deep if you use base href, so it will only save you that much html text for the most common file path.
You will have to sign and publish your site for new files to be available on ZeroNet. More new data, like say in the gigabytes, takes noticeably longer.
It works for me.

@Daniell Mesquita: Not Found
/boat

@Bussdee: The HTML: **<video src="Bussdee Remix.mp4"></video>** and then add style in CSS. You could use the CSS selector **video{*to-list-properties:here;placing-semicolons:between-and;closing-with:right-bracket*}** Those aren't actual properties, but an explanation of how you would lay actual ones out. You can have line breaks and spaces between them, but for values, I believe spaces are required, or else **padding:0055px *and* fixedno-repeat** probably wouldn't be read correctly by the browser. You can add specifity to selectors, such as jpg files under a div class and you can apply the same properties to multiple selectors. If you didn't know that, this will take further explanation. I search for these solutions a lot, but they do take time and some properties require additional properties to work with certain selected elements, because they may be online, block, or inline-block elements and have to be changed with the display CSS property or the HTML element needs to be changed. *Span* and *a* are inline and *div* is block.

I forgot to mention that in the video tag you'll need **controls="controls"** or you can use the anchor tag around an img tag: **** If you use an anchor tag around an img tag, then I recommend using the **img** selector in CSS.

Now for a more specific selector: **.list img[src$='.jpg']{** This sets enclosed properties to work only on jpg images under an element with **class="list"** If you swap **.list** for **#list** it will select for **id="list"** Note that you can only use **id="list"** or whatever id on only one element per page while classes can be used on multiple elements.
@Bussdee: That's what I ended up going with for my site. Overall, it's a nicer look and functionality.
